intro: Ferula talassica, commonly known as the coastal ferula, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils. Ferula talassica is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Its resilience to coastal conditions makes it an important part of the local flora in its native habitat.
